title: Drawing, June 7, 1901
medium: Brush and gray wash, graphite on cream-colored wove paper
markings: Recto: Stamped in ink, lower left: Museum for the Arts of Decoration Cooper Union [Lugt 457d]
signed: Signed and dated in graphite, lower left: June 7th 1901 T.M. [see inscriptions]
inscribed:
Recto: Inscribed in graphite, lower left: Ruxton, Col. / The "Fontaine"  [these two words have been struck out]  at "Manitou" / from the Cog R.R.  June 7th 1901 T.M.

Verso: Inscribed in black ink, upper left: No. 287.
description: Vertical view of a boulder-filled gorge with a stream in the foreground. Scenic view of mountainside with pine trees.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, June 7, 1901.
June 7, 1901. Brush and gray wash, graphite on cream-colored wove paper. Gift of Thomas Moran. 1917-17-82.
